turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I always, I-I always imagine that I have things.

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: When did you first notice this?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh, uh, about a month ago.  Wha- what do I have?

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: You've had some dizzy spells.  What about ringing and buzzing? Have you, uh, noticed any of that?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yes, now-now that you mention it, uh, I-I-I have, uh, buzzing and also ringing.  Ringing and buzzing. Um, am I going deaf, or something?

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: And it's just in one ear?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yes, is it, is it, uh, healthier to have problems in both ears?

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: What I'd like to do, is to make an appointment for you at the hospital. I'd like to have them run some tests.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: The hospital?  What kind of tests?

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: Now, don't get alarmed.  These are just more sophisticated audiometry tests than I can run here.  I mean, it's, it's nothing.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, if it's nothing, then why do I have to go into the hospital at all?  I mean, uh, I hear perfectly fine, so I'm, so I'm a little weak on the, on the high decibels.  So I, you know, I won't go to the opera.

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: You know, there's no reason for panic.  I just want to rule out some things.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: DR. ABEL
turns.text: It's nothing.  Will you trust me?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Dusty's just bought a huge house in Southampton and he's in the process of decorating it.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: Yeah.  It's kind of a weird place, actually.  A lotta wall space.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: How ya doin', man?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I told him about your work, and he's very excited.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: Yeah, I got an Andy Warhol.  And I got a Frank Stella, too.  Oh, it's very beautiful.  Big, weird...you know.  If you stare at that Stella too long, the colors just seem to float. It's kinda weird.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: What a weirdo that guy is!  Paranoid.  What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Look I-I-I'll be okay.  I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: It's not that big a deal.  We just didn't hit it off.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Now, look, you-you-you go on ahead.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: Are you okay?  You look-- You're sweatin'. ELLIOT  Yeah.  Yeah, I just-just need so- some-some fresh air.  It's probably something I ate.  I'll-I'll walk. You go ahead.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Hi, Dusty.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Are you excited about becoming a collector? DUSTY Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: I got a lot more to learn, though. I really wasn't into art when I was a kid.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Frederick's done this whole new series that I'm sure you would really love.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: Well, are...are they big?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah.  Some of them...yeah, some of them are very big.

turns.speaker: DUSTY
turns.text: 'Cause I got a lot of wall space there.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You--  Standards and Practices?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ed Smythe, yes.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Okay.  Why, all of a sudden, is the sketch dirty?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Child molestation is a touchy subject...

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Could you--

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: ...with the affiliates.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Read the papers!  Half the country's doing it!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes, but you name names.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: We nev-- We don't name names!  We say the Pope.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: We--

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: ...cannot go on the air.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, you know, I, I love that book you lent me.  The Easter Parade? You were right.  It had very special meaning for me.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: How's Frederick?  He didn't come.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, well, you know Frederick.  One of his moods.  Although it wasn't a bad week.  He  uh, sold a picture.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, great.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Really?  So, so, what else?  Wh- what are you up to?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, I don't know.  My unemployment checks are running out.  Um, I was thinking of taking some courses at Columbia with the last of my savings.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Like, uh...?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I don't know exactly.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: ...ex-husband on the street the other day.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, my goodness!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, Elliot!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Well, I'm-I'm looking for a bookstore.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, what, in this section of town?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes.  Yeah, I-I'm kill--

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: You're out looking here?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Well, yes, I'm killing time.  I have a client near here and I...I'm quite early.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Ohhhh!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: How about you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh.  Well, I live--

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, yes!  You live near here, don't you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yes, I do.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Where are you headed?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, I was just going to my AA meeting. ELLIOT Oh, my goodness.  Well, why do you still go to those?  You never tough alcohol.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, listen, you didn't know me before Frederick.  I'd...I'd start with a beer at about ten in the morning, and...go on.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh.  You must have been, uh, very unhappy.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah, unhappy and fat.  And I still find the meetings very comforting, you know.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I'll never understand it.  You're so bright and charming and beautiful.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, God.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I think to myself  what problems could she possibly have?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Don't let me get started on my childhood.  Oh, you know what?  There is a bookstore.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes? LEE  A couple of blocks from here.  If you don't know about it, you should. You'd really love it.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah, you would.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Well, i-if-if you have some free time...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Isn't this great?  They have everything here.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes, it's-it's wonderful.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What book did you want to buy? ELLIOT  What?  Book?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, book?  Oh, no, I...  I'm killing time.  I...I-I just, uh, w-want to browse, uh...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, you sure picked the right place.  I mean, you can stay here all afternoon, not buy anything and just read.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Unless, of course, if-if you had some time, I mean, we could get some coffee.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No, I don't have time.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No, no.  I-I-I understand completely. No problem.  Y-you're busy.  I-I-I...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: You seem tense.  Is everything all right?  You feel okay?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No!  No...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Uh, yes!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Everything's okay?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yeah.  How are you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I'm...all right.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: How-how's Frederick?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Fine.  Oh, we went to the Caravaggio exhibition at the Met.  It's such a treat to go through a museum with Frederick.  I mean...you learn so much.  Do you like Caravaggio?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, yes.  Who doesn't?  Look!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: e.e. cummings.  I'd like to get you this.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, no, I can't let you get me that. That's too much.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, oh, yes.  I-I-I-'d like to, uh, uh, very much.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No, I don't think so.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I-I read a poem of you and thought of his last week.  A poem of  his and thought of you last--  You'll be fine, though.  Lee walks over to Elliot in the center aisle.  She looks at the book.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Uh, uh, this is great.  I mean, I love e.e. cummings, but I can't let you get this.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes, I'd...I-I-I'd love, I'd love to get you this.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, sure.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: And-and maybe, um...maybe we could discuss it sometime.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Thanks for showing me the bookstore. Perhaps you could, uh, take me to an AA meeting sometime.  Uh...uh, I'd love to see what goes on.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, yeah, yeah.  You'd love it. It's really entertaining.  You'd have a good time.  I know you would.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: And, uh, d-don't forget the poem on page a hundred and twelve.  It reminded me of you.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Page a hundred and twelve.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: How's everything?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, you know...I talked to Hannah this morning on the phone, and she said that you two might be going to the country for the weekend.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yeah, she loves to go out in the woods.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: But I go nuts.  It's a conflict.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I have to get my teeth cleaned this week.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, that's nice.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I figured I'd get, uh, Frederick and Dusty together.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, that's really nice of you.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes.  This kid, he's earned a trillion dollars.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: He's got like six gold records.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, speaking of records...I bought that Mozart Trio you recommended...

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, you-you have that one?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, I would love to hear it.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, and Holly met a wonderful man who loves opera.  An architect.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, that's nice.  I'd love to see her wind up settled.  She's a tense one.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Isn't that beautiful?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I know this.  Bach.  F Minor Concerto.  It's one of my favorites.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Uh...did you ever get around to e.e. cummings?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yes, he's just adorable.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: They have a very large gay clientele, you know, where I get my teeth cleaned, and...all the hygienists now wear gloves because they're afraid of AIDS.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, right.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Did you ever get around to the poem on page a hundred and twelve?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yes, it made me cry  it was so beautiful...so romantic.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: And be ready to make light of the offer if she's unresponsive.  This has to be done very skillfully, very diplomatically.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Did you ever read this one--?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Elliot!  Don't!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Lee!  Lee!  Lee, I'm in love with you.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What are you doing?!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I...I'm-I'm-I'm-I'm sorry.  I have to talk to you for... There's so much that I want to tell you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Elliot!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I have been in love with you for so long.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I was looking for you.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I, I must apologize.  I-I'm, I-I'm sorry.  I'm so mixed up.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, how do you expect me to react to such a thing?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Wh--, uh, I know, I know but, I am in love with you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, don't say those words!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I-I, I'm sorry.  I know it's terrible.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Why, you know the situation.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I know!  I-I-I-I, I realize.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What do you expect me to say?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Hannah and I are in the last stages.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Wh-- She's never said anything, and we're very close.  She'd tell me such a thing.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Wh--, it-it-it-it, it's so sad. She's crazy about me, but somewhere on the, along the line, I've fallen out of love with her.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Not because of me, I hope.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, no, no.  Well, yes!  I love you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, I can't be the cause of anything between you and Hannah.  I jus--

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no.  It, uh, it-it-it- it was i-inevitable that Hannah and I part, anyway.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Tch, w-well, for a million reasons.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: But not over me?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Tch, no!  We were, we were both going in different directions.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Poor Hannah.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: But-but, but how about you?  Do you, do you share any of my feelings? Or is this just an unpleasant embarrassment to you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I can't say anything!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: W-well, please be candid.  I, I-I don't want you to feel bad.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yes!  But I...I have certain feelings for you, but don't make me say anything more, all right?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: O-o-o-okay, Lee.  Okay, okay.  You, you, y-you've said enough.  It's my responsibility now.  I will work things out.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Look, don't do anything on my behalf.  I live with Frederick, and Hannah and I are close.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes, but you, you do care about me.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, Elliot, please!  I can't be a party to this!  I'm suddenly wracked with guilt just standing her talking to you on the street!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Your guilt is because you feel the same.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, please, I have to go.  I have to get my teeth cleaned.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I thought you weren't coming.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I almost didn't.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Lee... uh...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I didn't sleep all night.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No, no-no-no, I'm sure.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I-I couldn't think where to invite you without taking risks.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I promised myself I wouldn't let this happen till you were living alone.  I was so torn when you called.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: This is not an easy situation.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I know it isn't.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: That was just perfect.  You've ruined me for anyone else.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I don't want anyone else ever to have you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I was so worried I wouldn't compare with Hannah.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You really do have those thoughts, don't you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, all the time.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I know she must be a really passionate person.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yes, she's, she's very warm, but, but it-it's me that wants to be giving to you.  I-I-I want to do things for you.  Hannah doesn't need me as much.  I'm being presumptuous.  Not that you need me.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I want you to take care of me... And I love when you do things to me.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You've been very cold to me tonight.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Is something wrong?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, not here.  There are too many people around.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: It's over, Elliot.  I don't know how to make it any clearer.  It's over.  I can't see you anymore.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Uh...  I-I-I know.  I deserve this.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Look, I'm just as much at fault.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: If-if-if you can believe I have such feelings for you!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I've got to be honest with you.  I met someone else.  I've met someone else.  I...I told you I wasn't going to wait forever.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: But it hasn't been forever.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: It's been nearly a year since our first time and you're still married to my sister, which...I now realize is fine because you're probably much more in love with her than you know.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yeah, but we-we made so many plans.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Yeah.  Uh, well, sure we did.  An- an-and in a way you led me on, because I truly believed you were unhappy with Hannah.  Otherwise, I would never have let myself be drawn in.  I was very weak.  So were you.  Now I've met someone else.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: And you're in love overnight?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I care a great deal about him, yes.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Lee...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Ah, it's over!  Elliot, I mean it. It's over!

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Mm-hm?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Have you tried these?  These are wonderful.  Holly and her friend made them.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: They're fantastic.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Aren't they great?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Your sister is an unbelievable cook.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I know!  I know!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: She has all the cooking talent.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No, she doesn't, either.  You've got tons as well.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Ohhh, but I've eaten five of these.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Great idea.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: That's where your talent lies.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: God, Mickey's such a hypochondriac. I wonder how he'd handle it if there was ever anything really wrong with him?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Let's go have dinner, shall we?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Holly and April, thanks for helping.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Where're you going?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I've, uh...gotta find, gotta get a phone number in my desk.  I forgot to phone Mel Kaufman.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It's so late.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  I-I can't believe I forgot.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Are you in a bad mood?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I don't know.  Um...I'm just antsy.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yes.  I know.  The last few weeks, you haven't been yourself.  And tonight at, tonight at dinner, you, you were kind of curt with me.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Was I?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yes, you were.  A-and when I, when I brought up the idea of having a baby, you just, you jumped down my throat.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Well, I-I don't think it's a very good idea.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Because it's the last thing in the world we need right now.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Why do you say that?  Is there something wrong?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, tell me.  Should I be worried?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: But, you got four children!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I want one with you.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Well...I-I think we should wait till things settle.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: But what do, what do you--  what's that mean?  W-w-we've been, we've been married for four years. How settled can things get?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You know, y-you have some very set plans on how your life should be structured.  A-a house, uh, kids, certain schools, a h--, a home in Connecticut.  I-it's all very...preconceived.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah, but I...uh--I thought you needed that.  When-when-when we met, you said your life was chaos.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I-I-I know, but there's got to be some give and take.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Oh, let's not--I, I don't know what the hell I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Are you angry with me?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Do you feel, um...are you disenchanted with our marriage?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: I didn't say that.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Are you in love with someone else?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: My God!  Wha-what is this?  The Gestapo?  No.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, what?  What, wh-what are you not telling me?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: What kind of interrogation... Su- supposing I said yes?  I-I-I am disenchanted.  I am in love with someone else.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No!  But you keep asking these, these awful questions.  My God, it's-it's like you want me to say yes!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: What, you, of c-- What are you talking about?  Of course not.  I'd be destroyed!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Have you been talking to Holly or Lee about us?  About our-our personal life?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Me?  Of course not. HANNAH There's things Holly wrote about in her script about us that are so...personal they could only have come from you.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm not accusing.  I'm asking.  Do you...do you find me too...too giving?  Too-too-too competent?  Too-too, I don't know, disgustingly perfect or something?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, what is it then?  What?  Eh, what's come between us?  How have I alienated you?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Hannah, my head is throbbing. HANNAH  You never want to talk about it. I-- Every time I bring it up, you- you change the subject.  What is it? Do you-- We're communicating less and less.  You sleep with me less and less.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Do you talk to Holly or Lee behind my back?  Do you?  You must.  They- they seem to know so much about us.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Well, maybe I've asked advice once or twice or-or made a joke.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well, what do you do?  Do-do-do you talk to Holly, or Lee, or what?  Do you, do you, do you phone them?

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: Leave me alone, can you?!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You matter to me.  Completely.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: It's hard to be around someone who gives so much and-and needs so little in return!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It's so pitch-black tonight.  I feel lost.

turns.speaker: ELLIOT
turns.text: You're not lost.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: ...this is a toast!  This is a toast.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Get his wine away.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: This is a toast.  You know this beautiful Thanksgiving dinner was all...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I am... I did slave all day.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: And we drink to her, and we all congratulate her on her wonderful accomplishment during this last year...her great success in A Doll's House!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I don't know about that.  Oh, no, I just, see, I-I've been very, very lucky.  W-when I had the kids, I decided to stop working and just, you know, devote myself to having the family, and I've been very, very happy  but...I've always secretly hoped that maybe some little gem would come along and tempt me back on the stage...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: ...just for a second.  So, now I got that out of my system and I can go back to the thing that makes me happiest.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Hi.  How's she doing?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I am glad to see you.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Don't make it worse, Dad.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Hi, Mom.  How you doing?  Here, let me get you some coffee.  That's enough of that.  What triggered it?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: We were making a commercial down at the mayor's office, and there was this young, good-looking salesman...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I want ice!  Who's got some--  Oh, there it is.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It's on the table, Dad.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Oh, Mom!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Oh, honey!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I don't understand.  I thought that you would be happy.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: How can we be happy?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, because I never thought of God in my life.  Now I'm giving it serious thought.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: But Catholicism?  Why not your own people?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Because I got off to a wrong foot with my own thing, you know.  B-b- b-but I need a dramatic change in my life. FATHER  You're gonna believe in Jesus Christ?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I know it sounds funny, but I'm gonna try.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: But why?  We raised you as a Jew.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: So, just 'cause I was born that way... You know, I'm old enough to make a mature decision.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Why should I be afraid?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Oh! 'Cause you won't exist!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: That thought doesn't terrify you?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Who thinks about such nonsense? Now I'm alive.  When I'm dead, I'll be dead.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I don't understand.  Aren't you frightened?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Of what?  I'll be unconscious.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  But never to exist again!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Well, it certainly doesn't look promising.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I'll either be unconscious or I won't.  If not, I'll deal with it then.  I'm not gonna worry now about what's gonna be when I'm unconscious.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Mom, come out!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Want some coffee or tea?

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: How about something to eat?

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: No, nothing.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Mmm, what am I gonna do with you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: God!  And why didn't you come tonight? We all had a terrific time.  I really think you would have enjoyed yourself.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: I'm going through a period of my life where I just can't be around people.  I didn't want to wind up abusing anyone.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: You're not going to abuse them. They're all so sweet.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Lee...  you are the only person I can be with...who I really look forward to being with.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Isn't it enough that I can love you?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Mmm...

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Hmm?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: ...you're such a puzzle.  So sweet with me and so...contemptuous of everyone else.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Well, there was a time  when you were very happy to be only with me.  You wanted to learn everything about poetry, about music.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Mm-hm.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Have I really taught you everything I have to give?  I don't think so.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Mmm  you never know.  They might.  He's just trying to do the nice thing.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Because he likes you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: Elliot lusts after you.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Based on what?  You never even see him.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: ...or films you must see or...

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no.  He's my sister's husband.  And I think if you gave him half a chance, you'd like him. He's very intelligent.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Big.  Frederick, show him the oils.

turns.speaker: FREDERICK
turns.text: They're in the basement.
